data.title: 12th Street Beat
data.meta_description: Posts about supergroup written by 12th Street Beat
data.text:
Mastodon, QOTSA and At The Drive-In members form new supergroup

Members of Mastodon, Queens of the Stone Age and At The Drive-In have formed a new band called Gone is Gone. Continue reading →

Alice In Chains, Mastodon and Mars Volta members form supergroup

Giraffe Tongue Orchestra is an all-star collaboration of Alice in Chains singer William DuVall, Mastodon guitarist Brent Hinds, Dillinger Escape Plan guitarist Ben Weinman, Dethklok bassist Pete Griffin, and former Mars Volta drummer Thomas Pridgen. Continue reading →

Slowdive, Mogwai and Editors members form supergroup called Minor Victories

A few of the UK’s most respected indie rockers are joining forces to form a new supergroup called Minor Victories. It is comprised of Rachel Goswell of Slowdive, Stuart Braithwaite of Mogwai, Justin Lockey of Editors, and James Lockey of Hand Held Cine Club. Continue reading →

Ozzy Osbourne forms supergroup with Slash, Geezer Butler and Tom Morello

Iconic Black Sabbath frontman Ozzy Osbourne has just formed a new supergroup. Along with Sabbath bassist Geezer Butler, Ozzy will join forces with Slash and Tom Morello for a performance at New Orleans’ Voodoo Music Experience on October 31st aka Halloween night. Continue reading →

Liam Gallagher, Roger Daltrey and Bonehead form TFI Friday supergroup

Founding Oasis members Liam Gallagher, Paul ‘Bonehead’ Arthurs and The Who frontman Roger Daltrey have joined forces to create a new supergroup for the 20th Anniversary special of cult TV show TFI Friday. Continue reading →

Dave Grohl, Corey Taylor, and Nick Oliveri-featuring supergroup Teenage Time Killer, announces debut album

Teenage Time Killers, the crossover thrash supergroup featuring punk and metal icons, has announced details of its debut LP. Entitled Greatest Hits Vol. 1, the album will arrive on July 31st through Rise Records.

Continue reading →

Teenage Time Killer supergroup featuring Dave Grohl, Corey Taylor, Keith Morris and Nick Oliveri will release an album in 2015

One of the more ridiculous supergroups to be formed in recent years, Teenage Time Killer may have taken the prize. The supergroup is comprised of Foo Fighter frontman Dave Grohl, Slipknot frontman Corey Taylor, Black Flag’s Keith Morris, former Queens Of The Stone Age bassist Nick Oliveri, The Dead Kennedys’ Jello Biafra, Lamb of God’s Randy Blythe and Corrosion Of Conformity members Reed Mullin and Mike Dean. The group has officially announced that they will be releasing an album in 2015.

Continue reading →

Oysterhead could reunite, Stewart Copeland says the band is interested

The jam band supergroup, Oysterhead is apparently considering the idea for a reunion in the near future. The band is made up of The Police’s Stewart Copeland, lead frontman of Primus Les Calypool and Trey Anastasio from the popular jam band Phish. The group was formed in 2000 and has released just one record together in 2001 titled, The Grand Pecking Order. Besides a short tour that same year and a couple random shows in 2006 the band has not been seen.

Continue reading →
